column4: Getting an error when trying to do a live session of ubuntu 11.04. ||initramfs||  using the same usb stick earlier today on another machine worked fine, this is an x64 compatible machine
what is the error
at that point in the boot process, everything is logged to the screen
no it wont write boot error logs to your flash drive
is what i mentioned enough information?
something about live is not
unfortunatly no
what filesystem is on the USB?
how did you make the USB?
do you have a linux system available to you to follow linux based how to's for making bootable USBs?

the problem is that, the initramfs is supposed to wait a few seconds for your USB device to be ready, but its not so it cant find the needed files. I recommend installing grub2 and using the isoboot method, but I cant find a good guide for it... yet
different machines have different USB controllers, and some chipsets are faster than others
this page explains how to make a grub2 isoboot setup but dosent explain how to install grub2 http://www.ubuntudoctor.com/content/blog/08/ISO-Booting-with-Grub-2-in-Ubuntu
regardless of chipsets and computers, the problem is that the deice is not ready
still around?
yeah
i was using a usb 3.0 port
used a 2.0, fixed
ahh, that makes no sense, but ill jot that issue down
now that i'm inside, its not detecting my usb 3.0 HDD - i'd assume the two problems are related?
my guess, is that usb30 kernel modules have not made it into the initramfs/livecd
is that to say if i installed the full version it would recognize my external 3.0 drive?
speaking from the linux kernel standpoint, USB 3.0 is supported... in ubuntu i have no idea
